comments.content: It looks like a **[Foundry Sterling ExtraBold/Book](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317115845/http:/www.fonts.com/font/the-foundry/foundry-sterling#product_1289149)** with a modified /J & /t

Thanks fvilanakis - it is indeed extra bold with character modifications
